name: Boeing 707
description: The first Jetliner, American long-range narrow-body airliner produced by Boeing Commercial Airplanes

name: Boeing 717
description: A twin-engine, single-aisle jet airliner, developed for the 100-seat market

name: Boeing 720
description: American narrow-body airliner produced by Boeing Commercial Airplanes, announced in July 1957 as a 707 derivative for shorter flights from shorter runways

name: Boeing 737
description: Developed to supplement the Boeing 727 on short and thin routes, the twin jet retains the 707 fuselage cross-section and nose with two under wing turbofans

name: Boeing 737 Classic
description: Narrow-body airliners produced by Boeing Commercial Airplanes, the second generation of the original Boeing 737-100/-200

name: Boeing 737NG
description: Narrow-body aircraft powered by two jet engines and produced by Boeing Commercial Airplanes

name: Boeing 737 MAX
description: 4th generation of Boeing 737 with narrow-body airliner manufactured by Boeing Commercial Airplanes

name: Boeing 747
description: A large, long-range wide-body airliner and cargo aircraft manufactured by Boeing Commercial Airplanes in the United States

name: Boeing 747-8
description: Wide-body airliner developed by Boeing Commercial Airplanes, the largest variant of the 747

name: Boeing 757
description: 7N7 was designed and built by Boeing Commercial Airplanes. It is a twinjet successor for the 727 (a trijet)

name: Boeing 767
description: Wide-body airliner developed and manufactured by Boeing Commercial Airplanes

name: Boeing 777
description: World's largest twinjet, designed to bridge the gap between Boeing's 767 and 747, and to replace older DC-10s and L-1011s

name: Boeing 777 X
description: The latest series of the long-range, wide-body, twin-engine Boeing 777 family from Boeing Commercial Airplanes

name: Boeing 787
description: The Boeing 787 Dreamliner is an American wide-body jet airliner manufactured by Boeing Commercial Airplanes

name: Boeing Business Jets
description: Variants of Boeing jet airliners for the corporate jet market. Its designation denotes the business jets based upon the 737 series airliners
